displayTitle: Responding to disclosures of sexual harm
body:
Before you get started

Our goal is to create a community where all staff and students feel totally safe.


One of the ways we’re doing this is by providing training to our staff, so if a student or colleague discloses something to you, you have the confidence to respond with care, guide the person to appropriate support and seek support yourself.


Your wellbeing is our priority; if the content of this module or this topic causes you distress, you can opt-out of being required to complete it. If you wish to do so, please click here to log a request to opt out. If you would like emotional support or support accessing resources, you can access our Employee Assistance Program (Benestar) on 1300 360 364 or contact the Health, Safety and Wellbeing team (healthandsafety@rmit.edu.au or via HR Assist 9925 0600).


To get the most out of this training, please watch each of the videos and read the content in all the tabs. Once you have completed all the sections, go to My Learning to access your certificate of completion.


Thanks for taking a step towards creating a safer community at RMIT.

_resources.description: The following resources provide more information about the content covered in this module. The different links referred to in this module and other useful links have been collated in the list below.

_resourcesItems.title: Change the Course: National Report on Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment at Australian Universities—2017

_resourcesItems.description: (Centres Against Sexual Assault (CASA) Forum fact sheet)
_resourcesItems.title: What Is Sexual Assault
RMIT student counselling and psychological support
RMIT Child Safe Standards Statement of Commitment
RMIT Protection of Persons Under 18 Year of Age at RMIT – Incident reporting and management process and guidance
1800RESPECT (national sexual assault, domestic and family violence counselling service): 1800 737 732
HR Health, Safety and Wellbeing team
RMIT has strengthened its support for victims and survivors of sexual assault by partnering with CASA house
